meanings.definition: To speak again or repeat aloud.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys respeaking her favorite quotes from movies.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the student to respeak the answer more clearly.
meanings.sent3: The parrot respeaking the same phrase over and over was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed in the empty room, respeaking her words back to her.
meanings.sent5: The child practiced respeaking the poem until it was perfect.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking again or repeating aloud.
meanings.sent1: His respeaking of the instructions helped everyone understand better.
meanings.sent2: The respeaking of the pledge of allegiance was done with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The respeaking of the joke made everyone laugh even harder.
meanings.sent4: The respeaking of the news spread quickly throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The respeaking of the song lyrics made the audience sing along.
